intro: Critonia dominicensis, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It blooms primarily in the morning, hence its common name, and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in tropical regions.
